New Records: Aaron Nola tied Cole Hamels for most wins at Citizens Bank Park with 56, and moved into seventh on the franchise's career wins list with 102.
The Phillies have won a franchise-record 30 straight games when the starter goes at least seven innings.
Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos hit a three-run homer to lead the Phillies to a 4-0 lead.
Trea Turner poked a single to right that scored Austin Hays, who opened with a leadoff double.
Alec Bohm added an RBI single in the seventh.
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies may have put their summer malaise behind them over the last two weeks, winning the last two games of a series in Kansas City and the first two games of a three-game set against Houston.
Manager Rob Thomson said, “I think we’re playing better baseball,”
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Nola earned a rousing standing ovation from the crowd of almost 40,000 fans after he finished the seventh.
Nola said, “It’s pretty cool. Curt was an unbelievable pitcher. It’s cool to be up there with him and those guys. That’s all good stuff at the end of the day, but I just want to win for the team.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: At 41 years, 189 days, Justin Verlander is the oldest active pitcher in the major leagues.
Verlander struck out three, walked one, allowed four runs and gave up seven hits in five innings.
Others: José Alvarado was expected to return this season after he was placed a day earlier on the restricted list for a personal matter.
The Astros send RHP Spencer Arrighetti (6-11, 4.94 ERA) to the mound against Phillies RHP Taijuan Walker (3-5, 6.26 ERA).
